poem:
"In Honour of the Artful Word"

Sixteen spirits dance in boundless script,
Enright, Grenville, Hammad draw the line.
First-timers all bring tales, tightly gripped,
In fields where grief and sisterhood align.

Booker nods to Maroo's Western tale,
And Binyam submits her Hangman's soul.
A testament to Art's enduring gale,
In their words, we find the heart's console.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Anne Enright and Isabella Hammad make the Women’s prize for fiction longlist Anne Enright, Kate Grenville and Isabella Hammad are among the writers longlisted for this year’s Women’s prize for fiction. Debut novelists make up half of the 16-strong longlist. Booker-shortlisted British author Chetna Maroo has made the list for her first novel Western Lane, which explores grief, sisterhood and sport, while American writer Maya Binyam was chosen for Hangman, about a man who returns". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
